title: Understanding the Correlation Coefficient
text: Let's first understand what a correlation coefficient means. A correlation coefficient of $$-0.26$$ indicates a weak negative correlation. This means that as one variable increases, the other tends to decrease slightly, but not in a strong or consistent way.

title: Analyzing the Scatter Plots
text: Look at each scatter plot and consider how tightly the points cluster around a line. A weak correlation will look more scattered. Can you identify which plot is more scattered than others while still having a slight downward trend?

title: Comparing Strength of Correlation
text: Compare the plots: which ones show a stronger downward trend and which show little to no consistent pattern? Remember, we're looking for a weak negative relationship.

title: Choosing the Correct Graph
text: Focus on each plot individually. Graph A appears to have scattered points with a slight downward trend. Does this fit with what you know about a correlation of $$-0.26$$?
